intro: Mollinedia iomalla, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its strap-shaped leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant is often found in coastal and forested areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its fibrous leaves have historically been used by Māori for weaving and crafting. Mollinedia iomalla plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and wildlife.
